targets.rawSql:
SELECT latitude, longitude, sensor_name, argMax(kwh_supplied, timestamp) > 0 as status
from sensors.charging_station
where group_name = '${group_name_charging}' and timestamp <= now()
group by latitude, longitude, sensor_name

with sequences as (SELECT sensor_name,
                          group_name,
                          timestamp,
                          kwh_supplied,
                          if(neighbor(sensor_uuid, 1, NULL) != sensor_uuid, NULL,
                             neighbor(timestamp, 1, NULL))            as next_timestamp,
                          dateDiff('seconds', timestamp, next_timestamp) as seconds
                   FROM sensors.charging_station)
select
    sumIf(seconds, kwh_supplied > 0) as occupied_for,
    dateDiff('seconds', $__fromTime, $__toTime) as max_time,
    sensor_name
from sequences
where group_name = '${group_name_charging}'
and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
group by sensor_name
order by occupied_for desc

panels.title: Total utilization time by charging station

panels.description: This chart shows historical data about charging station efficiency and utilization. Efficiency is calculated dividing the time the charging station was in use by the time the parking lot was occupied. The utilization instead is calculated dividing the charging station was used by the total considered time (which in this case is a day).

targets.rawSql:
SELECT group_name, timestamp, avg(efficiency_rate), avg(utilization_rate)
from sensors.charging_efficiency
where group_name = '${group_name_charging}' and timestamp > $__fromTime and timestamp < $__toTime
group by group_name, timestamp

panels.title: Whole park average charging station efficiency and utilization rates

targets.rawSql:
SELECT avg(efficiency_rate), avg(utilization_rate)
from sensors.charging_efficiency
where group_name = '${group_name_charging}' 
  and timestamp > $__fromTime 
  and timestamp < $__toTime

panels.title: Whole park average efficiency and utilization

targets.rawSql:
with max_efficiency as (
    select arrayJoin(sensor_names) as name,
           avg(efficiency_rate) efficiency
    from sensors.charging_efficiency
    where group_name = '${group_name_charging}' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
    group by name
    order by efficiency desc
    limit 1
),
min_efficiency as (
    select arrayJoin(sensor_names) as name,
           avg(efficiency_rate) efficiency
    from sensors.charging_efficiency
    where group_name = '${group_name_charging}' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
    group by name
    order by efficiency
    limit 1
),
max_utilization as (
    select arrayJoin(sensor_names) as name,
           avg(utilization_rate) utilization
    from sensors.charging_efficiency
    where group_name = '${group_name_charging}' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
    group by name
    order by utilization desc
    limit 1
),
min_utilization as (
    select arrayJoin(sensor_names) as name,
           avg(utilization_rate) utilization
    from sensors.charging_efficiency
    where group_name = '${group_name_charging}' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
    group by name
    order by utilization
    limit 1
)
select max_efficiency.name as max_efficiency_sensor,
       max_efficiency.efficiency as max_efficiency,
       min_efficiency.name as min_efficiency_sensor,
       min_efficiency.efficiency as min_efficiency,
       max_utilization.name as max_utilization_sensor,
       max_utilization.utilization as max_utilization,
       min_utilization.name as min_utilization_sensor,
       min_utilization.utilization as min_utilization
from  max_efficiency, min_efficiency, max_utilization, min_utilization;

panels.title: Most/least used/efficienct charging station in the park

targets.rawSql:
SELECT latitude, longitude, sensor_name, not argMax(is_occupied, timestamp) as status
from sensors.parking
where group_name = '${group_name_parking}' and timestamp <= now()
group by latitude, longitude, sensor_name

with sequences as (SELECT sensor_name,
                          group_name,
                          timestamp,
                          is_occupied,
                          if(neighbor(sensor_uuid, 1, NULL) != sensor_uuid, NULL,
                             neighbor(timestamp, 1, NULL))            as next_timestamp,
                          dateDiff('seconds', timestamp, next_timestamp) as seconds
                   FROM sensors.parking)
select
    sumIf(seconds, is_occupied = 1) as occupied_seconds,
    dateDiff('seconds', $__fromTime, $__toTime) as max_time,
    sensor_name
from sequences
where group_name = '${group_name_parking}'
and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
group by sensor_name
order by occupied_seconds desc

panels.title: Total occupancy time by parking lot

targets.rawSql:
SELECT sensor_name,
       'Traffic' as type,
       latitude,
       longitude
FROM sensors.traffic
where sensor_name = '${sensor_name_traffic}'
GROUP BY sensor_name, latitude, longitude

select toHour(date) as hour, argMax(vehicles, insertion_timestamp) as vehicles
from sensors.traffic_1h
where sensor_name = '${sensor_name_traffic}'
and date >= $__fromTime and date <= $__toTime
group by hour
order by hour;

select toHour(date) as hour, argMax(speed, insertion_timestamp) 
from sensors.traffic_1h
where sensor_name = '${sensor_name_traffic}'
and date >= $__fromTime and date <= $__toTime
group by hour
order by hour;

SELECT sensor_name,
       'Recycling Point' as type,
       latitude,
       longitude
FROM sensors.recycling_point
where sensor_name = '${sensor_name_recycling_point}'
GROUP BY sensor_name, latitude, longitude

select timestamp, filling
from sensors.recycling_point
where timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
and sensor_name = '${sensor_name_recycling_point}'
order by timestamp;

panels.description: This panel shows the cumulative hours that the recycling point has reached its full capacity, rendering it unusable, over a selected period of time.

targets.rawSql:
with sequences as (
    SELECT sensor_name,
           timestamp,
           if(neighbor(sensor_uuid, 1, NULL) != sensor_uuid, NULL,
              neighbor(timestamp, 1, NULL))     as next_timestamp,
           if(neighbor(sensor_uuid, 1, NULL) != sensor_uuid, NULL,
              neighbor(filling, 1, NULL)) as next_filling,
           if(next_filling == 100 and filling == 100, 1, 0) as saturated
    FROM sensors.recycling_point
    where timestamp > $__fromTime and timestamp < $__toTime
),
grouped as (
    select sensor_name,
           sum(if(saturated = 1, dateDiff('seconds', timestamp, next_timestamp), 0)) as total_seconds
    from sequences
    group by sensor_name
)
select *
from grouped
where sensor_name = '${sensor_name_recycling_point}';

panels.title: Total saturation

panels.description: Index from 0 to 10 which represent how efficient is the discharge of the selected recycling point. The longer the recycling point stays full without being emptied, the lower the index is and viceversa.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT avg(if(neighbor(sensor_uuid, -1, NULL) != sensor_uuid, NULL, neighbor(filling, -1, NULL)) AS previous_filling) as avg_filling
FROM sensors.recycling_point
where filling < previous_filling
and sensor_name = '${sensor_name_recycling_point}'
and timestamp > $__fromTime and timestamp < $__toTime

panels.title: Discharge Efficiency Index (DEI)

panels.description: This panel shows the percentage distribution of filling values for the sensor, categorized into three ranges: less than 50% (Low level), from 50% to 80% (Moderate level), more than 80% (High level).

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    range,
    (count(*) * 100.0 / total_count) AS percentage,
    CASE
        WHEN range = 'High level' THEN 1
        WHEN range = 'Moderate level' THEN 2
        WHEN range = 'Low level' THEN 3
    END AS sort_order
FROM (
    SELECT
        'Low level' AS range,
        filling
    FROM sensors.recycling_point
    WHERE sensor_name = '${sensor_name_recycling_point}' AND filling <= 50
    and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
    
    UNION ALL

    SELECT
        'Moderate level' AS range,
        filling
    FROM sensors.recycling_point
    WHERE sensor_name = '${sensor_name}' AND filling > 50 AND filling <= 80
    and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
    
    UNION ALL

    SELECT
        'High level' AS range,
        filling
    FROM sensors.recycling_point
    WHERE sensor_name = '${sensor_name}' AND filling > 80
    and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime

) AS ranges
CROSS JOIN (
    SELECT count(*) AS total_count
    FROM sensors.recycling_point
    WHERE sensor_name = '${sensor_name}'
    and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
) AS total
GROUP BY range, total_count
ORDER BY sort_order;

panels.title: Filling level percentages by range

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT group_name
FROM default.sensors
WHERE type = 'charging_station'
and group_name is not null
list.label: Charging
list.name: group_name_charging
list.query:
SELECT DISTINCT group_name
FROM default.sensors
WHERE type = 'charging_station'
and group_name is not null

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT group_name
FROM default.sensors
WHERE type = 'parking'
and group_name is not null
list.label: Parking
list.name: group_name_parking
list.query:
SELECT DISTINCT group_name
FROM default.sensors
WHERE type = 'parking'
and group_name is not null

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT sensor_name
FROM sensors.recycling_point
ORDER BY sensor_name
list.label: Recycling Points
list.name: sensor_name_recycling_point
list.query:
SELECT DISTINCT sensor_name
FROM sensors.recycling_point
ORDER BY sensor_name

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT sensor_name
FROM sensors.traffic
ORDER BY sensor_name
list.label: Traffic
list.name: sensor_name_traffic
list.query:
SELECT DISTINCT sensor_name
FROM sensors.traffic
ORDER BY sensor_name
